title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.7.7 | 10-12-2021
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Agyana Timiran Dhasya Gyanan Janishalakaya Chakshurun Militam Yena Tasvai Shri Gurave Namaha
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras, offering obeisances to the spiritual master and Lord Krishna.
segments.transcript: Om Agyana Timiran Dhasya Gyanan Janishalakaya Chakshurun Militam Yena Tasvai Shri Gurave Namaha Nama Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatya Deshatarine Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhi Gauravatta Vrinda Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare

segments.key_quote: Simply by giving oral reception to this Vedic literature... the feeling for loving devotional service to Lord Krishna... sprouts up at once to extinguish the fire of lamentation, illusion and fearfulness.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam (1.7.7) and explains that simply by hearing the Bhagavatam attentively, one can develop love for Krishna and overcome lamentation, illusion, and fear.
segments.transcript: Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naramchaiva Narottamam Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jayam Udhirayet. In this session we will be discussing from the 7th verse of the 7th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam: Asyamvai Shruyamanayam Krishnay Parama Purushe Bhaktir Utpadyate Pumsaha Shokamoha Bhayapaha. The meaning of this verse is: Simply by giving oral reception to this Vedic literature referring to the Srimad Bhagavatam, the feeling for loving devotional service to Lord Krishna, the Supreme Personality of Godhead, sprouts up at once to extinguish the fire of lamentation, illusion and fearfulness.

segments.key_quote: Through my ears I'm drinking the nectar of the words of the Srimad Bhagavatam spoken by Shukadev Goswami.
segments.summary: The speaker uses the example of Pariksit Maharaj, who listened to Shukadev Goswami speak the Srimad Bhagavatam for seven days without interruption, to illustrate the power of attentive hearing and absorption in the subject matter.
segments.transcript: See how effective Srimad Bhagavatam is. Simply you have to hear, this is called giving oral reception. You have to give oral reception, means you have to hear attentively. And simply you have to do that. What did Pariksit Maharaj do? He simply sat and heard Shukadev Goswami speak for 7 days and nights continuously. That's all he did. He didn't do any gymnastics. But he was hearing with complete attention. He was fully absorbed in the subject matter. So much so that Shukadev Goswami said, "Do you want to take a break?" He said, "No. There is no need for any break because through my ears I'm drinking the nectar of the words of the Srimad Bhagavatam spoken by Shukadev Goswami." So that nectar makes one indifferent to thirst, hunger, sleep, all these things cannot disturb a person who's completely immersed.

segments.key_quote: Simply by hearing Srimad Bhagavatam attentively, the feeling for loving devotional service to Lord Krishna... it sprouts up at once.
segments.summary: The speaker reiterates the importance of hearing the Srimad Bhagavatam attentively to awaken the dormant love for Krishna that is already present in the heart.
segments.transcript: So how does it work? That's what he said here, simply by giving oral reception to this Vedic literature, simply by hearing Srimad Bhagavatam attentively, the feeling for loving devotional service to Lord Krishna, the Supreme Personality of God, it sprouts up at once. It is awakened, it's there in the heart. This you have heard earlier, Nitya Siddha Krishna Prema Sadhya Kabuna. It is already there in the heart, this love for Krishna, but it is awakened by this process of attentive hearing of the Srimad Bhagavatam. And what does it do?

segments.key_quote: Material life means constant lamentation and everyone is after the mirage of illusory things.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that the Srimad Bhagavatam extinguishes the fire of lamentation, illusion, and fear, which are the primary symptoms of material disease, and quotes Srila Prabhupada on the effectiveness of the ear as a sense.
segments.transcript: It extinguishes the fire of lamentation, illusion and fearfulness. This is explained by Srila Prabhupada in the purport. Prabhupada says, "There are various senses of which the ear is the most effective ear. This sense works even when a man is deep asleep. One can protect himself from the hands of an enemy while awake, but while asleep, one is protected by the ear only. The importance of hearing is mentioned here in connection with attaining the highest perfection of life, namely getting free from three material pangs. Everyone is full of lamentation at every moment. Material life means constant lamentation and everyone is after the mirage of illusory things. The whole material creation is a creation of the illusory energy, and so many objects are there which bewilder the mind and people are simply running after this mirage. Mirage means something, a phenomenon or a death. In a desert, there is no water, but it appears like there is a body of water at a distance and one chases that body of water and never gets any water because there is no real water there in that mirage. Similarly in this material world, so many objects seem to be promising so much of happiness, but actually none of those objects can give us any real pleasure. And thirdly, he is always afraid of his supposed enemy, Shoka, Moha, Bhaya, these are three material pangs, which everyone in this material world who is born under the force of karma."

segments.key_quote: As soon as you hear from a pure devotee, the actual message of the Bhagavatam, immediately it relieves you from these three material pangs, immediately, you feel relief.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the symptoms of material disease (lamentation, illusion, and fear) and emphasizes the importance of hearing about Krishna from a pure devotee to experience relief from these pangs.
segments.transcript: These are the primary symptoms of material disease, Bhavaroga, it is called Bhavaroga, the disease of repeated birth and death. Everyone is affected by this disease in this material world and the primary symptoms, just like if somebody has got a viral infection, then they have a symptom called fever or some body pain, vomiting, loose motion, whatever, like that, what is the symptom of this material disease that is described as these three symptoms: Shoka, Moha, Bhaya. Shoka is lamentation, Moha is illusion and Bhaya is fear. And it is definitely suggested here in that simply by hearing the message of Srimad Bhagavatam, one gets attachment for the supreme personality. Krishna is very, very attractive, but you have to hear about Krishna from the pure devotee, because the pure devotee presents factually the actual personality of Godhead, not some speculated theory or some mental concoction, no, real Supreme Lord is presented by the pure devotee.

segments.key_quote: The ultimate result of devotional service is to develop genuine love for the first Supreme personality.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that the ultimate goal of devotional service (Bhakti) is to develop genuine love for Krishna, which cannot be achieved through other methods like Jnana, Karma, or Yoga.
segments.transcript: And as soon as this is affected, the symptoms of the material diseases disappear. As soon as you hear from a pure devotee, the actual message of the Bhagavatam, immediately it relieves you from these three material pangs, immediately, you feel relief. And that is the most encouraging part of the Bhagavad Gita. The process of Bhakti, Srila Vyasadeva saw the all perfect personality of Godhead and in this statement, the all perfect personality of Godhead Shri Krishna is clearly confirmed. The ultimate result of devotional service is to develop genuine love for the first Supreme personality. We have love for Krishna, but this is awakened only by this process of Bhakti. It cannot be awakened by the process of Jnana, Karma or Yoga. No material methods are possible to be practiced in order to awaken our genuine devotion or genuine love for Krishna. Love is a word which is often used in relation with man and woman. And love is the only word that can be properly used to indicate the relation between Lord

segments.key_quote: Love is the only word that can be properly used to indicate the relation between Lord Krishna and the living entities.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the relationship between Krishna and the living entities as one of love, comparing it to the affection between male and female, with Krishna being the Parama Purusha (supreme male) and the living entities being Prakriti (feminine).
segments.transcript: Krishna and the living entities. Why is that? Because the living entities are described as Prakriti in the Bhagavad Gita: Apareyam itasthu anyam prakritim viddhime paraam. Material energy is described as Apara Prakriti, living entities are described as Para Prakriti. So, we are Prakriti. Prakriti is feminine. The Lord is always described as the Parama Purusha, the supreme male personality. Thus, the affection between the Lord and the living entities is something like the affection between the male and the female in this material world. See why this is being said is because we have experienced what is the kind of affection that exists between a male and a female. So the term love of God, love of God is quite appropriate. If you understand from this perspective, we are feminine in terms of being Prakriti and the Lord is the supreme male. So the relationship is one of love.

segments.key_quote: Hearing about him means immediate contact with him.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes that loving devotional service begins with hearing (Shravanam) about the Lord, and because Krishna is absolute, hearing about Him is the same as being in direct contact with Him, removing material affections.
segments.transcript: That is how Prabhupada explains in this purport. Loving devotional service to the Lord begins with hearing about the Lord. Shravanam. This process for executing devotional service is hearing. There is no difference between the Lord and the subject matter heard about him. This is the absolute nature of Krishna. His descriptions are identical with his personality. The Lord is absolute in all respects and thus there is no difference between him and the subject matter heard about him. Therefore, hearing about him means immediate contact with him. The Lord is an absolute in all respects and thus there is no difference between him and the subject matter heard about him, by the process of vibration of the transcendental sound, the sound which is emanating from the lips of the pure devotee. When the devotee, pure devotee describes the Supreme Lord Krishna, that sound is a transcendental vibration and the transcendental sound is so effective that it acts at once by removing all material affections mentioned above. Everything is completely cleansed away by the powerful sound of the description of the Supreme Lord. As mentioned before, a living entity develops a sort of complexity by material association and the illusory engagement of the material body is accepted as an actual fact. We are entangled in this world and we accept this illusion as something which is real. Why is it called illusion? Illusion means something which is not real you accept as real, something which is not fact you accept as fact and the actual fact is rejected as something which is not real. This is the whole basis of illusion.

segments.key_quote: By hearing the subject matter of Srimad Bhagavatam this false complexity of materialism is removed and real peace in society begins.
segments.summary: The speaker uses the analogy of animals being attracted to each other to illustrate how illusion works and explains that hearing the Srimad Bhagavatam removes the false complexities of materialism, leading to peace and love.
segments.transcript: Under such false complexity, the living beings under different categories of life and become illusion in different ways. The way the illusory energy works is different for different living entities. Just like a dog, male dog is attracted to a female dog, a male pig is attracted to a female pig. Now from our perspective, the pig may be a very ugly creature or a filthy living in a filthy place in a gutter eating stool, abominable existence, but the evil energy of illusion is such that the soul in a male pig's body is attracted to the female pig's body simply to enjoy sex life, you see. Same thing happens even in bird society, animal society, even in human society also the same thing happens in the whole nature of the Universe by treating what is called happens. So Srila Prabhupada says, "Even in the most developed stage of human life, the same illusion prevails in the form many isms and divides the loving relation between the Lord and the living entities, thereby it divides the loving relation between man and man, between one living, one human being, another human being, but by hearing the subject matter of Srimad Bhagavatam, this false complexity of materialism is removed and real peace in society begins which politicians aspire for so eagerly in many political situations." So peace is the prerequisite for love, there is no possibility of love without peace.

segments.key_quote: The Srimad Bhagavatam is the only literature which gives us perfect description of the Supreme Lord... and such contact with the Lord through simply hearing attentively will ensure that our heart becomes cleansed.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by reiterating that the Srimad Bhagavatam is the only literature that perfectly describes the Supreme Lord, and attentive hearing of it cleanses the heart, removes misconceptions, and awakens love for Krishna.
segments.transcript: As long as our mind is agitated, disturbed, there is no possibility of love, experiencing love. So the Srimad Bhagavatam is the only literature which gives us perfect description of the Supreme Lord which is identical with the Lord and such contact with the Lord through simply hearing attentively will ensure that our heart becomes cleansed of all these misconceptions, all the wrong understanding, all the material complexities are removed and love is at once awakened. So that is the process, that's how it works. I'll stop here, thank you very much.
